===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|ま|じん|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=まじん}} {{m|ltc|魔神|tr=*mɑ? *jhin|lit=demon, evil spirit” + “god, spirit}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|魔神|tr=móshén}}.

The [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] reading, so likely the reading as originally imported from {{etyl|ltc|-}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|まじん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|まじん}}

# a [[malevolent]] [[deity]] that causes [[misfortune]] and [[disaster]]
# an [[evil]] [[spirit]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|evil spirit}} {{ja-r|悪魔|あくま}}

=====Usage notes=====
The ''mashin'' reading appears to be less common than the ''majin'' reading.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|ま|しん|yomi=on}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''majin'', using the [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading of ''shin'' for {{ja-l|神}}.

{{IPAchar|/mad͡ʑin/}} → {{IPAchar|/maɕin/}}

A mixed [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']]-[[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading reading, so likely a later development after borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|acc=0|ましん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ましん}}

# a [[malevolent]] [[deity]] that causes [[misfortune]] and [[disaster]]
# an [[evil]] [[spirit]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|evil spirit}} {{ja-r|悪魔|あくま}}

=====Usage notes=====
The ''mashin'' reading appears to be less common than the ''majin'' reading.
